intro: Peucedanum ampliatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with a slender stem and aromatic foliage. Its flowers are small and white to pale green, appearing in late spring to early summer. Peucedanum ampliatum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
